customer_reviews.text: Loved the camera had it for a year when one day I went to shoot a wedding with it and it decided to not turn on. It was working the day before and never had an issue. I'm giving this a 1 star review because of the repair process my local shop couldn't fix it so I had to send it in to Sony. customer_reviews.title: Slog2 and SLog3 is extremely noisy at certain ISO's and then is great at others
customer_reviews.text: This camera is the low light master, but you do need to dig into its software to really make it work well in low light and other scenarios. Do your research about settings before jumping into a low light shoot. For example, Slog2 and SLog3 is extremely noisy at certain ISO's and then is great at others. As a long time Canon DSLR user, it crosses over well. All in all, I think Canon has a better picture look and user layout, but again, this camera is the definite winner when it comes to low light shooting!

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched from a Canon 5D Mark II to this beast. Incredible difference. Pros -4K is stunning. -120 fps is stunning. -5 axis IS is stunning. Shot a whole wedding handheld. -Low light is stunning. High ISO is great but lower ISO compared to the 5D is a joke. Makes the 5D look like a Razr camera. -Crop mode is useful. If you have a 35mm lens like me, you now have a 35 and a 50. With the 120fps you also have a 80mm roughly. Three lenses in one. Cons -Battery -Can't use function buttons to switch shooting modes or crop mode. -Kinda expensive. If you have the money just get it.
